column4: any ideas why i would be getting terrible write speeds (~5mb or slower, usually slower) on a disk-to-disk file copy? i've tried dd'ing a 2gb file from /dev/zero to each and get respectable speeds (60mb/s on the single driver, 240mb/s on the raid)
where does raid fit into the picture?  what are the source and destination disks?  individual disks?  raids?  different partitions on the same disk?
are you passing any special options to dd?
